founder.translation[0].definitions[0].de: someone who establishes a business, organization, school etc
founder.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to fail after a period of time because something has gone wrong
founder.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Their marriage began to founder soon after the honeymoon.
The talks foundered on disagreements between the two parties.
founder.translation[1].definitions[1].de: if a ship or boat founders, it fills with water and sinks
founder.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The ship foundered on the rocks.
founder.translation[2].definitions[0].de: a person who starts a new company or organization
founder.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: The companyâ€™s founder and chairman, Charles Munch, has resigned.
founder.translation[3].definitions[0].de: if a company, plan, job etc founders, it fails or is unsuccessful
founder.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: Two major companies foundered this week.
A potential rescue deal foundered after they rebuffed an offer of $2.5 million.
The institution foundered on huge loan losses.
